nodes.title: Samsung Electronics
nodes.short_description: Largest memory competitor; pricing, capacity, and technology leadership drive DRAM/NAND supply-demand and pricing.

nodes.title: SK hynix
nodes.short_description: Major DRAM/HBM competitor; capacity decisions and technology pace affect Micron's pricing and share.

nodes.title: Nvidia
nodes.short_description: Top HBM buyer; AI accelerator demand directly drives Micron's HBM and DRAM sales.

nodes.title: Kioxia
nodes.short_description: Key NAND competitor; output cuts or expansions influence industry pricing and Micron margins.

nodes.title: Western Digital
nodes.short_description: Major NAND rival, Kioxia JV partner; supply strategies materially impact flash pricing and competition.

nodes.title: DRAM
nodes.short_description: Core Micron product; pricing cycles and node transitions determine revenue and profitability.

nodes.title: NAND Flash Memory
nodes.short_description: Core product; hyperscaler and device demand drive pricing, bit growth, and utilization.

nodes.title: High Bandwidth Memory (HBM)
nodes.short_description: Critical for AI workloads; GPU adoption drives volume, pricing, and capacity investment.

nodes.title: Data Center and AI Infrastructure
nodes.short_description: Primary demand engine for DRAM/HBM; hyperscaler buildouts shift product mix and pricing.

nodes.title: Smartphone Manufacturing
nodes.short_description: Large consumer of DRAM/NAND; handset cycles directly impact shipments and average selling prices.

nodes.title: U.S. Export Controls on Semiconductors to China (BIS Rules)
nodes.short_description: Restrict advanced chip and tool exports; reshape Micron's China sales and supply chains.

nodes.title: CHIPS and Science Act (U.S.)
nodes.short_description: U.S. subsidies and guardrails influence Micron's domestic investment, capacity, and compliance.

nodes.title: China Cybersecurity Review Ban on Micron in Critical Infrastructure
nodes.short_description: Bars Micron memory in Chinese critical infrastructure, reducing market access and revenue.

nodes.title: United States
nodes.short_description: Headquarters and fab locations; policies and incentives significantly guide strategy and operations.

nodes.title: China
nodes.short_description: Major end market; regulations and domestic competitors shape demand, pricing, and access.
